conclusion: Analyze the motion of particles A and B based on their velocity-time graph.
Both particles start from rest at the same time, so their initial velocity is v0.
The velocity-time graph for particle A shows it moves from rest to a velocity of 2v0 in the first t0 seconds.
The velocity-time graph for particle B shows it moves from rest to a velocity of 2v0 in the first t0 seconds.
Both particles will meet when their velocities are equal, which is when their velocity graphs intersect.
The intersection point occurs when the velocity of both particles is 2v0.
Since both particles start at the same time, the time at which they meet is 2t0.
Verify that the time 2t0 satisfies both particles' motion conditions: both start from rest, move in the same direction, and reach the same velocity.
Conclude that particles A and B meet at 2t0.
The particles A and B meet at 2t0.
